Remember<S>2142</S> now thy Creator<S>1254</S> in the days<S>3117</S> of thy youth<S>979</S>, while the evil<S>7451</S> days<S>3117</S> come<S>935</S> not, nor the years<S>8141</S> draw nigh<S>5060</S>, when thou shalt say<S>559</S>, I have no pleasure<S>2656</S> in them;
While the sun<S>8121</S>, or the light<S>216</S>, or the moon<S>3394</S>, or the stars<S>3556</S>, be not darkened<S>2821</S>, nor the clouds<S>5645</S> return<S>7725</S> after<S>310</S> the rain<S>1653</S>:
In the day<S>3117</S> when the keepers<S>8104</S> of the house<S>1004</S> shall tremble<S>2111</S>, and the strong<S>2428</S> men<S>582</S> shall bow<S>5791</S> themselves, and the grinders<S>2912</S> cease<S>988</S> because they are few<S>4591</S>, and those that look out<S>7200</S> of the windows<S>699</S> be darkened<S>2821</S>, <sup>the grinders: or, the grinders fail, because they grind little</sup>
And the doors<S>1817</S> shall be shut<S>5462</S> in the streets<S>7784</S>, when the sound<S>6963</S> of the grinding<S>2913</S> is low<S>8217</S>, and he shall rise up<S>6965</S> at the voice<S>6963</S> of the bird<S>6833</S>, and all the daughters<S>1323</S> of musick<S>7892</S> shall be brought low<S>7817</S>;
Also when they shall be afraid<S>3372</S> of that which is high<S>1364</S>, and fears<S>2849</S> shall be in the way<S>1870</S>, and the almond tree<S>8247</S> shall flourish<S>5006</S>, and the grasshopper<S>2284</S> shall be a burden<S>5445</S>, and desire<S>35</S> shall fail<S>6565</S>: because man<S>120</S> goeth<S>1980</S> to his long<S>5769</S> home<S>1004</S>, and the mourners<S>5594</S> go about<S>5437</S> the streets<S>7784</S>:
Or ever<S>3808</S> the silver<S>3701</S> cord<S>2256</S> be loosed<S>7576</S> <S>7368</S>, or the golden<S>2091</S> bowl<S>1543</S> be broken<S>7533</S>, or the pitcher<S>3537</S> be broken<S>7665</S> at the fountain<S>4002</S>, or the wheel<S>1534</S> broken<S>7533</S> at the cistern<S>953</S>.
Then shall the dust<S>6083</S> return<S>7725</S> to the earth<S>776</S> as it was: and the spirit<S>7307</S> shall return<S>7725</S> unto God<S>430</S> who gave<S>5414</S> it.
Vanity<S>1892</S> of vanities<S>1892</S>, saith<S>559</S> the preacher<S>6953</S>; all is vanity<S>1892</S>.
And moreover<S>3148</S>, because the preacher<S>6953</S> was wise<S>2450</S>, he still taught<S>3925</S> the people<S>5971</S> knowledge<S>1847</S>; yea, he gave good heed<S>239</S>, and sought out<S>2713</S>, and set in order<S>8626</S> many<S>7235</S> proverbs<S>4912</S>. <sup>moreover: or, the more wise the preacher was, etc</sup>
The preacher<S>6953</S> sought<S>1245</S> to find out<S>4672</S> acceptable<S>2656</S> words<S>1697</S>: and that which was written<S>3789</S> was upright<S>3476</S>, even words<S>1697</S> of truth<S>571</S>. <sup>acceptable: Heb. words of delight</sup>
The words<S>1697</S> of the wise<S>2450</S> are as goads<S>1861</S>, and as nails<S>4930</S> fastened<S>5193</S> by the masters<S>1167</S> of assemblies<S>627</S>, which are given<S>5414</S> from one<S>259</S> shepherd<S>7462</S>.
And further<S>3148</S>, by these<S>1992</S>, my son<S>1121</S>, be admonished<S>2094</S>: of making<S>6213</S> many<S>7235</S> books<S>5612</S> there is no end<S>7093</S>; and much<S>7235</S> study<S>3854</S> is a weariness<S>3024</S> of the flesh<S>1320</S>. <sup>study: or, reading</sup>
Let us hear<S>8085</S> the conclusion<S>5490</S> of the whole matter<S>1697</S>: Fear<S>3372</S> God<S>430</S>, and keep<S>8104</S> his commandments<S>4687</S>: for this is the whole duty of man<S>120</S>. <sup>Let: or, The end of the matter, even all that hath been heard, is</sup>
For God<S>430</S> shall bring<S>935</S> every work<S>4639</S> into judgment<S>4941</S>, with every secret thing<S>5956</S>, whether it be good<S>2896</S>, or whether it be evil<S>7451</S>.
